headline: Veggie Pizza
description: This veggie pizza is made from crescent-roll dough and a cream cheesy spread for an easy, fresh take on a favorite — packed with crunchy vegetables.

video.description: A great way to tastefully get raw veggies into an appetizer!
video.name: Veggie Pizza

name: Veggie Pizza

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a jelly roll pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Press crescent roll dough into the prepared jelly roll pan to form a crust. Let stand 5 minutes. Pierce with a fork.
Bake in the preheated oven until dough is fully cooked and golden brown, about 10 minutes. Let cool completely.

Combine sour cream, cream cheese, ranch seasoning mix, dill, and garlic salt in a medium mixing bowl. Spread the cream cheese mixture on top of cooled crust. Arrange broccoli, radish, onion, bell pepper, carrot, and celery on top of the cream cheese mixture.
Cover and let chill, 1 to 2 hours. Cut chilled pizza into 16 squares to serve.

review.reviewBody: always a big hit! I add cauliflower but everything else as listed and it turns out perfect every time
The spread was too runny. I think adding less sour cream will make a huge difference.
Try adding bacon to veggie pizza!! Trust me … you will thank me!!
I topped with broccoli, cauliflower, red pepper, celery, carrot, green onion, radish, black olives and shredded cheese. Was a tad too salty but pretty good overall.

I remember having this at my families Christmas parties and loved it. It is always a hit. However I only use one pack of cream cheese and instead of sour cream I used 1/2 cup of Mayo (not miracle whip) and it is super yummy. I can eat the whole pan.
Delicious! I did not use all the veggies listed, and used a pre-made ranch dip.
I made it and loved it! Will make again soon.
I used a roll of pizza crust instead of crescent rolls. Tastes just like I remember as a child. Love the dill. I put diced ham on 1/2 and black beans on the other half in addition to the veggies.
Didn't change a thing! Came out great and even my kids loved this! Will definitely be making again
Delicious! Here’s a tip! Cut the crust BEFORE you spread the mixture and veggies on the top. Makes it much easier and cleaner!
Very good for parties and gatherings! We used broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, and peppers.
I always have to make 2 when I bring it to a party so I can leave 1 at home for the family to eat.

Super simple! Great taste! I followed the directions as it states but added different veggies (onion, tomato, carrots, cucumber, broccoli, cauliflower, red and orange peppers. Delicious! It had a ton of veggies on a
So the cream cheese combo wasn’t overpowering like others suggested. I also added shredded cheese. 
So even though I altered the recipe I think this is a fantastic recipe!
An old favourite. I don’t bother adding the extra spices, there’s lots of flavour in the ranch dressing package.
fantastic even though i forgot to poke holes in the dough. family loved it!! :-)
I followed the recipe exactly, except for the veggies on top. I used carrots, broccoli, and cauliflower. Excellent!
I used whatever veggies I had on hand and it came out great! Everybody loved it!
Added chopped black olives and mushrooms
Always love this, I have made it so many times!!

Mayo/ no sour cream. Pilsbury Pizza crust instead of crescent. 
Add frozen peas, cherry tomatoes, and cheese on top

Did not make any changes ! The grandkids said Grandma when will you make this again! Everyone at the family gathering said it was the best tasting veggie pizza they had! Would definitely make it again.
I didn’t have dill so I used Mrs Dash. It turned out great and was the hit at a family gathering. I’ve made it several times, my family loves it and I just use whatever veggies I have on hand.

So good! This recipe was perfect and very easy to follow. I altered the veggies on top for my preference but did everything else exactly as written. One tip: be sure to chop the veggies small, like in the picture. I have had it (made by other people) with larger pieces of veggies and it makes it hard to eat and less enjoyable because you don't get the nice mixture of different veggies.

Every time this is served at my church for social hour, I usually take a slice or two even on the go. I'm so glad I found this recipe here on All Recipes. I've made some adjustments to my pizza: instead of a full pie, I've only did half of the crescent roll. Instead of a full packet, I've used half of the sour cream, skipped celery (don't like it), used orange instead of red peppers, and let it chill for 15 minutes. Delish! I would make it again-though I didn't make it twice. An error over here.
I added a little bit of milk to the cream cheese mixture. It made it a little bit creamier and made spreading so easy!!!
I think the dill makes it! Love it!

Best tasting veggie pizza I've ever had! proportions are perfect. I made it for valentines day and used a small heart cookie cutter to cut some of the veggies. It turned out beautifully and very tasty! Thanks for a great recipe!
I would make it again and it's so easy to make

Made this for family and work about 5x. I highly recommend as years later they remember how good this recipe is. The day before I mix the ‘sauce’ ingredients to allow it to permeate. The night before, I cook 2 tubes of crescent rolls on a 12x18” cookie sheet and cut into 18 pcs. It can be challenging to stretch it evenly. I like to made things proportional (the tedious part) so I give myself enough time to cut the toppings perfect and to make sure the rinsed broccoli etc. isn’t dripping wet. For transporting, I place another cookie sheet inverted over it and strap tape around it. Then I time how long it takes people to eat all 2 of them. My own sister told me last month that it is good which is surprising to her because it is full of ingredients she doesn’t like, but all together...

I made this last night for myself while my family had Dominos (I cut the recipe in half). It was delicious! Super easy which is a huge bonus also! I had leftovers for lunch today and still enough for one more meal. I will definitely be making this again and again!
cool
Very good. I would cut the cream cheese mix by a fourth since I had some left even though I put it on quite thick and also used a cookie sheet so the crust was larger than 9x13.
Absolutely delicious and very easy to make.,I forgot to take a picture though.in a hurry to get to my picnic.
Really good but I might use slightly less than the 1 oz. Pkg Ranch.. it may be too strong a flavour for some people using the full thing.
It turned out amazing!! We’re huge fans but only had it at parties. I didn’t want to wait for the next party so I decided to make it, we added some cheese to the top. So good!!
Nice little kick with the ranch dressing. This is now a household favorite. So many different combinations of vegetables can be used.
I used an 18x13 cookie sheet so doubled the cream cheese to fit; used the full pkt. of ranch dressing and added 1/4 cup sour cream to make the blending easier. Astounding recipe!
Very simple and you can use just about any fresh vegetables you like.

I make this often for potlucks at work and I always get rave reviews and never any leftovers. I've found the amount of crust and filling work much better on a 13" x 18" half sheet pan. It's just too much for a jelly roll.
we made it last Friday.it tested sooo good. but still have some defects

I have been making this for years. My mom called it summer pizzia. We don't roll the dough over the sides of the pan but leave it flat. Use whatever veggies you like. If you don't like raw broccoli, you can steam it a few minutes, ice to chill and then chop. To the review who commented that without a chopper it's a lot of time, it's true, but thats what cooking is about. It's a dish that you can also have family & friends chop to turn into a group activity. You can also divide it into halves or thirds, so my husband & I could enjoy mushrooms and olives but my daughter could have twice the carrots and added some shredded cheese. We also cut with a pizzia cutter.

I have made this over a dozen times and everyone always loves it. I've made this recipe exactly as written along with some changes due to what I had on hand. Now when I make it I always use a pizza crust, bake it for 10-12 minutes allow it to cool then add my toppings. The topping are interchangeable and can be adapted to what is in season. I've even in a last minute pinch omitted the sour cream but in that case I felt the cream cheese layer was a little over powering. Every time I make it I top it with a little grated cheddar cheese (~1/4 c). Love it!! Thank you for the excellent crowd pleasing appetizer.

I have made this several times. I usually use greek yogurt instead of the sour cream and I have told people they like the "healthier" version even better. my Co-worker request this whenever we have food days
so very tasty!
I made it as written and everyone said it was too salty. Next time I will add only half the ranch dressing as some people suggested.
So glad I found your recipe cause I lost mine from years ago. I know it's excellent and well loved by all!
Used broccoli, cauliflower, onion, and carrots for topping. Big hit.
I've made this exact thing, though I didn't have this recipe. It's all the same except I never have added garlic or dill, it's always been perfect with the powder ranch packet.

Great receipe ...I forgot to poke holes in the dough before I bake it my crust was a little too thick. I always add a few more spices to it .. Everyone love it too! I also padded the vegetables into the cream cheese mixture it did help so everything did not fall off when you took a bite...
I made this numerous times as is which is good. But when I make it with a pre made bread shell such as Boboli, it is much better. It holds up for a longer time without getting soft or soggy.

I've been looking for this recipe for over 15 years. It was made for me as a child because of my tomato allergy. I am so thankful that I found it. After making it, I realize the "adult" me has different taste buds, but it had a lot of memories in it. You have no idea how long and hard I have looked for this over the years. Now, I can move on. Thank you!
My family devoured this veggie pizza. I made to snack on Memorial Day before our huge BBQ dinner. It was a huge hit.

This was delicious! Mine turned out a little salty, but I believe it was due to the fact I misread the ingredients and instead of 2 8oz packages of crescent rolls, I only had 1. Which made my cream cheese/sour cream mixture to dough ratio a little off. Other than that, it was great!

Followed the recipe and it came out perfect. I wanted to try something different and saw this recipe. Very delicious pizza. Next time, I would like to try it with shredded cheese and black olives. You can get really creative with this dish!
I made this recipe to exact loved it i used 90 cal croissant rolls n lowfat creem cheese n sour. Cream
I love this recipe! I did use less mayo and Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. It is a really great way to have your veggies without the boring vegetable tray.
I will definitely make it again...for sure!

I used to make this with my mom with a few changes. We used vegetables my brother and I would eat (no onions). You can use just about anything (finely chopped or grated). Re: the mixture. We mixed to taste. Basically, we combined all the ingredients in smaller amounts and then continued to add to the mixture according to our preference. All in all, this makes for an easy, and yummy, meal that the kids can help prepare and, amazingly, eat (with no complaints).
I've made this for appetizers for a party and it was great. Also made last summer for teens at camp and it was a real crowd-pleaser- so different from packaged snacks!

Really tasty and can be made weight watcher friendly easily. I have also made it with roasted veg cooled to room temp. A real hit of flavor for a bit of fat from minimal good oil. Thanks for the recipe ... very summery as written.

Great recipe and always a crowd pleaser. I use three tubes of crescent rolls and pat them out in my large cookie sheet that has sides. That way there is the correct amount of cream cheese mixture to spread over the cooled crust. Of course I up the amount of veggies to cover. Always top this with shredded cheddar cheese. Perfect!

I have used plain yogurt in place of sour cream and knorr swiss vegetable soup mix in place of spices. Very accomodating to my individual taste
 and quicker.
My mom used to make this for parties. It is fantastic!
Very yummy. Takes a lot of prep time to cut the veggies. The crust needs to completely cool before you put the cream cheese spread on.
Bacon
Love this recipe for college game days! Great crowd pleaser!
When I the Veggie Pizza every time I bake this everybody it is gone so fast!
Always a crowd pleaser!! Everyone wants the recipe. Thanks for posting.

Excellent recipe! I omitted the onions based on personal preference, and added some fresh dill that I had on hand. I made this for a church potluck and prepped it the night before. I baked the crust, chopped the veggies and mixed up the "sauce". I then refrigerated overnight in separate containers so nothing got soggy. Layered it all together in the morning and stuck it in the fridge at church for approximately 3 hours till lunch time. Everyone loved it! I got tons of compliments!

Oh goodness, I can't stop laughing at the ones that think this was to be served for dinner. This is an appetizer type recipe. That may be why you think the ranch dressing is overpowering..it's an appetizer!!! The thought of eating this as a meal is making my stomach ache. lol
My aunt made this every holiday and I couldn't wait to get to her house.

Very good! I like to chop the carrots and then use shredded cheddar cheese to top the whole thing!
I would suggest, like another reviewer mentioned, to push the veggies down so they stick to the pizza better. Or else it is a mess to eat.
I really like this recipe. It's quick , easy, and everyone likes it. I end up doing half onion half without .
I would give this a 3.5 even though there's not a star for it!
Presentation was great and flavour was good but a lot of prep for an appetizer

I have made this for many gatherings, and its always everyone's favorite. The only change I made was I didn't use radishes, and I did add shredded cheddar cheese. I couldn't imagine it without cheese :) this appetizer is always a hit! Thanks for sharing!
I did not have ranch mix so I used the ready made veggie cream these. Turned out great
I wish it didn't taste so good!
Very good, will make it again and make the crust a little more crispy.

Instead of crescent rolls I use the pre made pizza crusts that are in the isle with the pizza sauce. That way you don't have to cook them & wait for them to cool. I also use olives, mushrooms, broccoli, cauliflower & cheddar cheese.
I used a food processor to chop all the veggies, it was much too salty for my likings. Next time no garlic salt and less ranch packet!

The ranch flavor was too strong for my taste - and I like ranch! I use ranch seasoning in many recipes, but it just overpowered this one. I'm not going to give up, though. I may attempt to tweak it next time, maybe less ranch and more dill.

I tried this recipe for a bridal shower. It was a tropical theme, so I tried to make it "Hawaiian". I used less of the ranch and dill, and used tomatoes, green onion, pineapple, orange and red peppers and Deli ham for toppings. People loved it that way as well.
This is a great recipe. I made it for my brother's wedding and got lots of compliments.
I love it. Someone made it at a family bbq.It was so good. Its my new snack favorite.
Very tasty!!! Was gobbled up right away! So fresh
I'm going to be making it again soon and I think I'll try using French onion dip instead of sour cream and leave out the chopped onion altogether. Easier + more flavor!
I thought this was great! I added some cheddar cheese on top, next time I think black olives would be a good touch.
This recipe is fantastic! It's one I get asked to make at almost every event I attend, especially family functions. Wouldn't change a thing!
Unused Greek cream cheese & Greek yogurt in place of regular cream cheese & sour cream.
I've made this for several parties and everyone raves about it! Don't feel like you have to use the same veggies it suggests, do whatever veggies you like!
Too salty. I would leave out the salad dressing mix and just use garlic powder and salt/pepper to taste with the dill. I pulsed the veggies in a food processor so it was easier to eat.

Awsome recipe. I did exactly as directed, except I used 3 cans of crescent rolls and made a very large pizza, and had enough left over to make a small pizza for myself and kids before the party. There was just enough cream left for it. Glad we got to eat that, cause by the time we got through the line to get food, the pan was polished clean. I also added a large spoonful of mayonaise to the cream mixture to improve flavor and used my own variety of vegetables including tomatoes, onion, red bell pepper, broccoli, carrot and shredded cheddar. Everyone raved about how good it was.

This was not a hit at my party. Nothing wrong with the recipe, but no one really "dug" it. I probably won't make again. Make sure you dice your veg really fine. This is better when bites are easy, and big veg makes for difficult bites.

I always make this for parties. The only change I make is not adding garlic salt, and of course my personal preferences for what veggies to use. I always try to make the "sauce" at least a couple hours before I plan to assemble. Gently press the veggies into the sauce after assembling, it helps to hold everything together when eating.

Great! Made this for my boyfriends birthday party, everyone loved it! I used light sour cream and cream cheese and was still very flavorful! I used less than half of an onion, since I was serving it at a party I knew if it had a whole onion on it people would stay away from it. Will totally make this again!

The 'sauce' is odd tasting to me. I didn't use all of the ranch packet and I actually added more sour cream to try and back down the salty taste. Which is odd as I love salt and could practically eat it from the shaker. I also love fresh veggies with ranch. This recipe just fell flat. Good enough to serve at my party, but I won't be making this again. I once had a veggie pizza years ago and it was delicious this one not so much.
Yum!
dill makes it! used half mayo and half sour cream - much better, I think!
